poem:
### In the Gray of Chains

In the cell's stark whisper,  
a life's breath waned—  
cloaked in shadows  
stumbling name by name  
toward lightless echoes  
where justice falters,  
unwrapping in silence  
a powerful hand's  
severed promise.  
The bars spoke through  
a mother's lament—  
weights of a fragile morning  
folding at the seams.
